description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Microsoft Bluetooth driver spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-21306), apply the relevant updates listed below:

1. Download and install the appropriate KB articles based on your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, use KB5034123
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2, use KB5034123
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2, use KB5034121
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64 and 32-bit), use KB5034122
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64 and 32-bit), use KB5034122
   - For Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems, use KB5034129

2. Access the corresponding update packages from the following links:
   - [KB5034121](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034121)
   - [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - [KB5034130](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034130)
   - [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122)
   - [KB5034129](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034129)

**Details**:
- This update resolves the spoofing vulnerability which may allow an attacker to impersonate a Bluetooth device.
- Ensure your system matches the build numbers listed for compatibility before proceeding with the updates.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify that the system is running a compatible version of Windows 10 or Windows 11.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with installation.
